result.execSummary:
The defendant Deandrew D Hunter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges including DNA to be paid by 10-05-16. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deandrew D Hunter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

Court ordered defendant to serve 134 days in the House of Correction, with 134 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA) to be paid by 10/05/2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Deandrew D Hunter in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to Possession of Cocaine, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 964.41(3g)(c), a Class a Misdemeanor.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Defendant has been discharged.  Court is down the rest of the week, court will address at the next court date.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Defendant missed office visit.  Parties contacted to schedule bail review.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Christopher W, Joseph W, Terrance W or Reginald J.
Court orders cash bail be converted to a $750 signature bond with TURN OVER to Justice Point.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Deandrew D Hunter not in court, in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for bail review.  For reasons stateed on the record, the Court GRANTS defense motion for bail reduction.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deandrew D Hunter in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Deandrew D Hunter in custody.  David John Behm for Laura Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Deandrew D Hunter not in court, in custody. Patricia Daugherty for Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant's appearance is waived for todays proceedings. 
  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Court increased bail to $5000.00 cash. Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 8/13/2015 at 1:30 pm.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Deandrew D Hunter not in court, in custody. Nick Cerwin for Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Due to the lateness of the day, case rescheduled for BAIL REVIEW on 7/8/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Deandrew D Hunter in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Deandrew D Hunter in custody.  Nicholas Cerwin for Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Defense Counsel requests sequestration of all State's witnesses.  Sworn for the state:Dean Newport-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CHRISTOPHER W., JOSEPH W., TERRANCE W. AND REGINALD  J.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

CASE RECALLED AT 12:34; SAME APPEARANCES.
CASE PASSED AGAIN PENDING NCIC REPORT.
CASE RECALLED AT 1:12; SAME APPEARANCES.  NCIC REPORT RECEIVED.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO NOT CROSS STATE LINE UNLESS PRIOR AUTHORIZATION/APPROVAL FROM JUDGE.

Defendant Deandrew D Hunter in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Deandrew D Hunter in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  

CASE PASSED

Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
